features: Every Purchase Saves Pets. BISSELL proudly supports the BISSELL Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets.Specific uses:Hard Floor
Powerful Spinning Mop Pads. Restore your floor's natural shine with rotating mop pads that do the work for you.
Safe On Sealed Hard Floors. Powers through tough, sticky messes on wood, tile, linoleum, and other sealed hard floors.
On-demand Spray. Control how much solution goes on the floor while cleaning.
Easy to Maneuver. Designed with a low profile and swivel steering, so it's great for cleaning tricky spaces like along baseboards.
Mop Pads & Formula Included. Comes with 4 soft-touch pads, 2 scrubby pads, trial-size Hard Floor Sanitize Formula, and 2 trial-size Wood Floor Formulas.
body.description: No more getting down on your hands and knees to scrub the floor! BISSELL SpinWave Hard Floor Expert uses powered spinning mop pads to safely clean sealed hard floors, so it does the work for you. It's safe and effective on tile, sealed wood floors, laminate, linoleum, rubber floor mats, pressed wood floors, and more. The on-demand spray control allows you to put as much, or as little, solution on the floor as you need. SpinWave Hard Floor Expert's lightweight design and swivel steering make cleaning along baseboards and under furniture and cabinets easy. And while you’re cleaning, don’t worry about disrupting others around you. SpinWave Hard Floor Expert was engineered to make minimal noise while in use, giving you a powerful clean without the powerful noise. The machine also comes with a removable, Easy-Fill Clean Water Tank that has a filling guide for cleaning both small and large areas. Plus, it comes with 2 scrubby mop pads for tough, sticky messes, 4 soft-touch mop pads for everyday cleaning, a trial-size bottle of Hard Floor Sanitize Formula, and 2 trial-size bottles of Wood Floor Formulas that leave behind a fresh scent. This product also helps save pets! BISSELL proudly supports BISSELL Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets. When you buy a BISSELL product, you help save pets, too. We’re proud to design products that help make pet messes, odors and pet homelessness disappear.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Safely On Sealed Hard Floors Safe and effective on tile, sealed wood floors, laminate, linoleum, rubber floor mats, pressed wood floors, and more! On-Demand Spray Spray trigger allows you to control how much formula goes on the floor while cleaning. Quiet Cleaning SpinWave Hard Floor Expert provides powerful cleaning without the powerful noise. Lightweight & Maneuverable SpinWave Hard Floor Expert is engineered with swivel steering, making it an easy way to clean around furniture and along baseboards.

Easy-Fill Clean Water Tank Simply fill the clean water tank with water and Hard Floor Sanitize or Wood Floor Formula, spray and mop pet messes away! Washable Mop Pads Includes reusable (2) scrubby and (4) soft-touch microfiber pads. Scrubby for tough, sticky messes. Soft-touch pad for everyday gentle cleaning use. Formulas Included Includes Hard Floor Sanitize Formula and two Wood Floor Formulas to gently clean sealed hard floors. Every Purchase Saves Pets BISSELL proudly supports BISSELL Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets. When you buy a BISSELL product, you help save pets, too.

Clean Up After Pets Scrubby mop pads & PET Multi-Surface Formula with Febreze Freshness work together to eliminate pet odors and messes while you clean. Sanitize Hard Floors Hard Floor Sanitize Formula & soft-touch mop pad cleans and sanitizes, eliminates 99.9% of bacteria.* *Kills 99.9% of Enterobacter aerogenes (ATCC 13408) and Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 6538). Clean Sealed Hard Floors Multi-Surface Formula & scrubby mop pad let you seamlessly switch between cleaning different sealed hard floors. Clean Wood Floors Soft-touch mop pad is gentle on sealed hard floors. Plus, when combined with the Wood Floor Formula, both help to restore your floor's natural shine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Pros: I usually use a spin mop on my hardwood wood floors and title. This made it so much easier on me! I have one bad wrists and a worst wrist. Actually having another surgery on the worst one next week. This is a self propelled mop and it made life so much easier. I just guided it around the room.It didn't put to much water on the floor, it was just the right amount. It cleaned the floor better than the spin mop, not quite as good as doing it by hand, but who has time for all of that?It was super quiet, way quiet than I expected. I mopped while my granddaughter slept in the same room. I can also mop while holding her.The water tank holds a lot more than expected.Cons: The chord is shorter than I would have preferred. The solution that it came with is just okay. Easy fix is too use my normal brand.It doesn't get into the grout too clean the tile floors very well. But the title floor itself is very clean.The scrub pads are easy to remove and to put back on, however the are held on by velcro. I is a must to have an extra set of pads or when you remove them the Velcro will become less effective. Bad design flaw there.This will NOT replace sweeping or vacuuming before use. If you want a combo this is not the machine for you! It will only push dirt or debris around it will not vacuum it up.Overall, I really like this mop and am happy with the purchase! I'd recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An easier alternative to traditional mopping
reviews.reviewText: I have been using an O'Cedar spray mop (but the spray broke so I had to spray by hand with a bottle). I have textured, light LVP throughout the 2,200 SF house with grouted tile in the bathrooms and laundry. We're a 2 adult/2 dog household. I dry mop 1-2x wk, vacuum 1x wk, and then mop. I purchased this to work on the high-traffic areas, but also possibly replace the other mop.Overall, it's a good alternative to the hand mop approach which is quite a workout for me.- Pro: very easy to put together and use- Pro: pads are easy to install and remove- Pro: pads are easy to hand clean if you want to do so between rooms or dirtier areas of the house- Pro: easy to store; doesn't take up a lot of space- Pro: low noise level with a beep when misting floor with cleaner- Pro: uses 2-cups of water before adding formula (I use white vinegar). This covers a 2,200 SF home.- Pro: easy-to-use water/formula bottle; no tricky installation or removal.- Con: if you have arthritis, carpal tunnel, or any hand sensitivity or neuropathy, this could be challenging to manage and guide. While there is no noticeable vibration, the need to guide its direction might require two hands. You can use two hands because it's not very fast or ornery on its own. Just know that you might have to take a hand break.- Con: because the speed is slow, cleaning a full house could take a bit of time. I think it's a good 1-2 hours compared to a shorter time for a traditional mop (because we're more likely to push/pull faster). You don't want to push/pull this mop too fast, it won't be as effective.- Con: this doesn't apply heavy contact to the ground that you'd likely be able to apply with a traditional mop. It does pick up dirt, for sure, but not quite like I've achieved with a hand mop. ** Tip: wet the pads, wring them out, and then install on the mop. When I used this the first time, with dry pads, they didn't pick up as much dirt. The water primes the pad to clean and pick up dirt. I did this with my standard mop with the same success. **- Con: this won't clean your tile grout, dug-in stains hardened dirt, or grooves of tile, hardwood, or LVP. This is a standard mop that rotates while going in a vertical direction. I think it has an advantage over a standard mop, but it's not the holy grail I was hoping for. I use the soft and scrubby pads (striped white and gray) that came with the purchase. I might invest in the scrubby pads (they're pink)This mop has made this activity easier than bending over, spraying the floor then mopping. I'm also more likely to mop the full house vs rotating between sections in addition to always mopping high-traffic areas each week. I might not get the same workout as with the mop, but I'm happy with it. I will keep the other mop for minor issues. I also keep a Swiffer for quick tile clean-ups. Edited to add photos.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We got this to help do a better job at cleaning with floors without requiring a ton of elbow grease. So far, I love it. It's very easy to use and operate. The pads are holding up well through use and washing (I let them air dry, tho, to try to prolong their life). I love that the I can see how dark the white pads turn after use since it makes me feel like I'm truly getting the dirt up. We also liked the pet cleaner that came with it and ended up ordering a larger bottle. It's got a nice, fresh scent without being overwhelming.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does A Good Job in cleaning Hardwood floors
reviews.reviewText: I have had three Bissell Spinwaves - it is a good machine for hardwood floors. The BIG DOWNSIDE OF THE SPINWAVE IS THAT IT WILL ONLY LAST 2 YEARS THEN - DEAD. That is why i have owned three.The manufacturing quality of the Spinwave is not very good and even if you take good take of the equipment, it always fails after two years of occasional use.
